THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNICMAJESTY1 S GX)VERNMENT.SECRET /i qW.P.(R)(4l)9. WAR CABINET Copy No.12th February, 1941.Notifications of Infectious- Diseases.Note by the Minister of Health.I circulate herewith for information a return of the notifications of the principal infectious diseases during, January, 1941.I think it well to mention that, as between London and the restof the country, the figure s must be looked at in the light of the fact thatthere has been a large evacuation of children from London.E. 3.MINISTRY OF HEALTH12th February, 1941.
Infectious Diseases London Administrative County. Remainder of England and Wales. Period ended 28.1.39. Period ended 27.1.40. Period ended 25.1.41. Period ended ; 28.1.39. Period ended 27.1.40. Period ended 25.1.41.Cholera Typhus Smallpox Scarlet Fever Diphtheria Enteric Fever Measles Whooping Cough Pneumonia Dysentery cerebro-spinal-spinal fever Poliomyelitis Polioencephalitis Tuberculosis fa) Respiratory (b) Other Forms mm) 518 484 14 Not notifiable 678 32 21 ) - . 396 72 mm 145 110 7 114 62 415 8 27 321 45 314 176 6 1,912 130, 367 63 74 2 287 25 1 6,004 4,591 76 Not notifiable ii 5,928 98 116 65 1,416/ 291/ 2 ' 4,328 2,940 36 11,207 2,716 5,878 136 464 33 1,209/ 339/ 4,768 4,777 64 60,743 11,557 5,515 270 1,015 38 1,393/ 464// The figures for tuberculosis, including those for 1939 and 1940, are derived from a newreturn which has not yet been received from all authorities. The figures now in thereturn cover about one-half of the population of the country.Notifications of Infectious Diseases during periods of 4 weeks as specified hereunder.
